remarks.para: May be inoperative provided operations comply with AOM/AA Data anti-skid inoperative procedures and performance data.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

numlitem.para: Maximum takeoff thrust must be used.
For rejected takeoff:
Immediately place all thrust levers to idle.
Deploy full speed brakes.
Apply steady light braking for weights under approximately 500,000 lbs. or apply steady light to moderate manual braking at heavier weights.
For landing:
Deploy full speed brakes immediately after touchdown.
Apply steady light braking for landing weights under approximately 500,000 lbs. or apply steady light to moderate manual braking at heavier weights. Modulate brakes as necessary to prevent skidding.
Observe performance limitations.
Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 1.
Compute V1 using the V1 correction, Cluttered/Icy Runway or Complete Anti-Skid System Inoperative worksheet in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
Apply anti-skid inoperative takeoff weight performance penalty as found in the AA takeoff data.
Apply anti-skid inoperative landing weight performance weight correction in the AA landing data.
If "Obstacle Clearance Altitude (OCA)" is present on the AA Data for the departure runway, contact Flight Control for alternate AA Data.
All brakes must be operative.
All Thrust Reversers must be operative.
Use cutback runway is prohibited.

placard.para: Install Placards as directed in DMP procedure. Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

para.emphasis: Following conclusion of the MAINTENANCE (M) procedure, if EICAS message ANTI-SKID or ANTI-SKID OFF remains displayed, the Fault isolation procedure must be performed prior to every departure to determine if additional anti-skid faults occurred en route. Contact Aircraft Maintenance Control to inform them of a repetitive inspection requirement.

numlitem.para: FAULT ISOLATION:
Conduct a CMC Brake System Ground Test to identify anti-skid fault(s):

note.para: The ground set-up procedure may be simplified as follows:
The IRUs do not need to be in NAV mode. (Ignore any IRS signal fault indications.) Hydraulic pressure is not required. Autobrake system does not need to be armed.

numlitem.para: Select 32 BRAKE CONTROL from the CMC GROUND TEST menu.
Execute the BRAKE SYSTEM BITE test. Record all anti-skid system configuration and input faults annunciated during the test.

Following the conclusion of the CMC Brake System Ground Test, select the line-select key opposite the FAIL prompt on the CMC and record the anti-skid system fault. Continue to select the NEXT PAGE key on the CMC as required and record the anti-skid system faults.

note.para: When CMC message PARK BRK VLV NOT OPEN WHEN RELEASED or NO PARK BRK PWR is displayed, dispatch is not allowed (Brake Torque Limiter is inoperative). This condition causes EICAS Status message PARK BRK VALVE as well as ANTI-SKID OFF and BRAKE LIMITER Advisory messages.

numlitem.para: MAINTENANCE REQUIREMENTS:
Install Placard Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "ANTI-SKID SYSTEM - INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

If CMC messages ANTI-SKID TRANSDUCER X FAIL and/or BSCU FAIL; ANTI-SKID CONTROL CHANNEL X-Y are identified in fault isolation (Step 1) above, open and collar C/B(s) corresponding to the affected wheel(s) as indicated in the Circuit Breaker (C/B) Table below:

note.para: Each C/B contains a fore-aft locked-wheel-protection pair. If any two circuit breakers associated with wing gear wheels are open, body gear steering will be inoperative.

numlitem.para: If CMC message NO POWER ON ANTI-SKID CHANNEL X-Y is identified, the associated anti-skid system channel is already unpowered. Therefore, it is not required to open associated CB(s).
If CMC message NORMAL ANTI-SKID VALVE X FAIL is identified, verify manual operation of the normal brake system for the affected wheel(s):
Provide electrical power to all operative anti-skid and torque limiter channels (AMM 24-22-00/201).
Chock wheels.
Pressurize hydraulic system 4.
Fully depress and fully release brake pedals. Observe the brake wear indicator pins and/or brake pistons to verify that the affected brakes apply and release.
If manual operation is not available:
Open the P180 panel ANTISKID X-X circuit breaker for the affected wheels.
Remove and stow associated anti-skid valve electrical connector(s).
Close the opened circuit breakers.

note.para: Previous deactivation of the associated wheel antiskid system may require the circuit breaker be collared.

Since one C/B provides power for anti-skid protection of two wheels, if a failed valve interferes with manual braking the electrical connector is removed from the valve instead of opening and collaring the associated C/B.

numlitem.para: Fully depress and release the brake pedals and confirm the brake wear indicator pins and/or brake pistons indicate the affected brakes apply and release.
